reviews.review7: I am writing this review after using this device since last 10 days. In those 10 days I tested this device in every mean possible. So here is my detailed (and a short) review ----->>>>Build - This phone is really a champ when it come to its build quality. Its super thin, only 7.5mm. Its lightweight too. You may need to hold it carefully as it has slippery back (but not too much, only above average). Front looking is not so good but its really nice when it comes to its back looking.Feels premium in hands. I dropped this phone on first day itself and it proved its toughness.No damage was done to body or display when it was dropped from 5 ft to stone floor.Build - 10/10Display - Display is very sharp and crisp. Also, the touch is so smooth that you will love it while using. It has Full HD Display and it really produces great colors. The 5.2 inch display makes it easier to use it in one hand easily. Also, there is a protection cover (some sort of tempered glass) on the display and it protects the display from dust and fingerprints. For added safety, you can also use another tempered glass. As for me, its not required.Display - 10/10Performance - The octa core kirin 650 Processor makes sure that phone runs smoothly. I havent noticed any lag in this device while navigating through different apps. I also played some heavy games like Asphalt 8, Mortal Kombat X and I have never spotted any lag in FPS. This device can run all games very smoothly.There is no question on lag when using it normally. reviews.review8: *Review on my Honor 7x after 2 weeks of usage*After a month of research on best phones under 20k budget, bought this budget smartphone from Amazon on March 26.The phone has met my expectations.My previous android phones: Sony Xperia L, Lenovo p70*About this phone*Ram management is good - smooth running, didnt feel any lags, hang, or heating issues yetPremium looks with metal body, curved big screen (5.93 inch), good for watching videos and screen resolution and sunlight visibility is goodCall clarity is good even in noisy places..Phone speaker is placed in bottom of the phone and output is average for music, but with the earphones it is awesome.Fingerprint sensing is awesome n speedy, (the feature I liked very much.. for unlocking phone easily and the feature can be used for applications too.) Some features like smart assistance and app lock feature, split screen is good.A feature called eye comfort, (filters blue light to reduce eye strain) is very useful. Auto brightness too is sensitive n working fine.Battery backup: with moderate use lasts one day full. Not recommended for heavy gamers. The only game I plays in mobile phone is Wcc2 and the battery is draining bit fast.There is no turbo charging in this phone, it takes 2- 2.30 hours for full charge.Camera performance is satisfactory for me.. Takes some good photos except in low light and night. Front cam photo.. and quality for video calling is good. Some features like bokeh, wide aperture, portrait modes are good n fun.. and there is mode like pro photo and pro videos in which u may take better pics n vids(didnt try much)It comes with a hybrid sim slot.. So I opted for 64 gb variant. Hope it will be much enough for storage and I can use two sims at a time.After few days of purchasing, I got an update including face unlock feature.. Dont wanna use though.. Seems good.."Heard Oreo update is coming soon.."Verdict: Satisfied n happy with the phone.. And recommends this phone to my friends.. Rating 8 out of 10..Read mor

reviews.review8: *Review on my Honor 7x after 2 weeks of usage*After a month of research on best phones under 20k budget, bought this budget smartphone from Amazon on March 26.The phone has met my expectations.My previous android phones: Sony Xperia L, Lenovo p70*About this phone*Ram management is good - smooth running, didnt feel any lags, hang, or heating issues yetPremium looks with metal body, curved big screen (5.93 inch), good for watching videos and screen resolution and sunlight visibility is goodCall clarity is good even in noisy places..Phone speaker is placed in bottom of the phone and output is average for music, but with the earphones it is awesome.Fingerprint sensing is awesome n speedy, (the feature I liked very much.. for unlocking phone easily and the feature can be used for applications too.) Some features like smart assistance and app lock feature, split screen is good.A feature called eye comfort, (filters blue light to reduce eye strain) is very useful. Auto brightness too is sensitive n working fine.Battery backup: with moderate use lasts one day full. Not recommended for heavy gamers. The only game I plays in mobile phone is Wcc2 and the battery is draining bit fast.There is no turbo charging in this phone, it takes 2- 2.30 hours for full charge.Camera performance is satisfactory for me.. Takes some good photos except in low light and night. Front cam photo.. and quality for video calling is good. Some features like bokeh, wide aperture, portrait modes are good n fun.. and there is mode like pro photo and pro videos in which u may take better pics n vids(didnt try much)It comes with a hybrid sim slot.. So I opted for 64 gb variant. Hope it will be much enough for storage and I can use two sims at a time.After few days of purchasing, I got an update including face unlock feature.. Dont wanna use though.. Seems good.."Heard Oreo update is coming soon.."Verdict: Satisfied n happy with the phone.. And recommends this phone to my friends.. Rating 8 out of 10..Read mor

reviews.review2: I have been using this from around last 3 months, previously i was using motoG Turbo and it is a lot better phone in terms of everything except the build quality. screen get scratched easily and phone is bend from one side i dont even realized when.-CameraIt has a great camera in this price range and it offers a lot of shooting modes, Portrait mode is just fine, i dont use it much but sometimes it gives really good results. it even provides a pro mode but sadly no raw support, it can shoot 1080 video with good audio pick up, it can shoot slow motion video but it is bad. front camera and video quality is decent. overall the camera is really good for the price and moreover the camera software rocks !!- BatteryOne can expect a full day of battery life with heavy usage easily. if you are a normal use it can last you about1.5 to 2 days. Very Happy with the battery cause i never have to think about it for the whole day. it would have been great to see the fast charging though.-DisplayGreat Display with good color reproduction.-PerformanceI dont play games so i wont talk about gaming performance. Overall good performance in day to day usage. but now i feel there is a bit of lag sometimes after updating to emui 5.0, it happens rarely till now so, not much worried about it.If you are a person who wants good camera phone in this price range with decent battery life go for it. i chose it over redmi note 4 for camera.i wish it would have a better build quality, a bit loud n clear audio from speakers and raw support in camera. Hope this helps.ThanksRead mor
reviews.review1: Brought this phone on March 2017,with a very quick delivery from Amazon. I would recon it as one of the best Value for Money mobiles in this price segment!Initially I was hesitant to buy a mobile from the Huaweis sub company Honor since it wasnt much known in India. But within a day of usage that thought was changed! Huaweis own Kirin chipset is a fabulous one maintaining power performance and energy at unbelievable rate. The battery lasts for a solid day for heavy usage(playing a movie, playing atleast 800MB sized game, etc)Spotlight goes to the dual camera setup which is the first known in this segment price range mobiles! Im not at all disappointed with its outdoor condition lighting and slips in artificial lights(it can be rectified in Pro Photo mode if u could fit the adjustments) The only lack in camera is the video stabilization...could have been better than given.Cons have to be absence of NFC and the second sim being only 2G support. Other than that it is a stylish,killer mobile!(And Im also became a fan of EMUI now which I was not before)Read mor

reviews.review2: First pros!1. Performance - AwesomeYou can very well compare it to any phone with Snapdragon 8352. Screen - Awesome18:9 aspect ratio full hd+ IPS LCD display with great viewing angles, color reproduction and brightness levels. You wont miss the amoled display from Samsung or oneplus.3. Memory - Awesome128 GB rom and 6 gb ram. Gives you 100gb usable storage. And 4gb free memory out of the box.4. Fingerprint scanner : awesomeFast, responsive, and placed where I like it. In the front.5. Camera - AwesomeDual camera, bokeh effect, low light, front camera, front bokeh, beautification, AR feature ... Everything best in class!6. Looks - Good EnoughBlue color looks great from front, a little boring from the back.7. Battery - Awesome20-30% always left after a long busy day. Lasts 30hrs for me.8. Extra - Face recognition, Ir blaster, headphone jackNow cons!1. Charging time: Too slowFor me, it takes 3-4 hrs to full charge. I leave it to charge all night2. A bit bulky: one handed usage is a bit difficultOneplus has smaller footprint with same screen size but v10 has fingerprint scanner in the front.3. Audio output: could have been betterSamsung, LG, oneplus all have great audio outputs. This one is a tad bit low on that front.4. No OIS or EIS : need steady hands for low light stills and videos are always shaky.5. Resale value : it will not get the resale value like iPhone or Samsung or even like oneplus. Monetary value for this one will fall greatly.I chose this over oneplus 5t because I wanted 128gb memory, front fingerprint scanner under 30k. With 3k extra oneplus 5t gives lower memory and for 128gb it costs 38k. Oneplus does not give anything special for 8k extra. Honor will not fetch a resale value like one plus but if you plan to use this for at least 2 years. You should be good.Read mor

reviews.review2: First pros!1. Performance - AwesomeYou can very well compare it to any phone with Snapdragon 8352. Screen - Awesome18:9 aspect ratio full hd+ IPS LCD display with great viewing angles, color reproduction and brightness levels. You wont miss the amoled display from Samsung or oneplus.3. Memory - Awesome128 GB rom and 6 gb ram. Gives you 100gb usable storage. And 4gb free memory out of the box.4. Fingerprint scanner : awesomeFast, responsive, and placed where I like it. In the front.5. Camera - AwesomeDual camera, bokeh effect, low light, front camera, front bokeh, beautification, AR feature ... Everything best in class!6. Looks - Good EnoughBlue color looks great from front, a little boring from the back.7. Battery - Awesome20-30% always left after a long busy day. Lasts 30hrs for me.8. Extra - Face recognition, Ir blaster, headphone jackNow cons!1. Charging time: Too slowFor me, it takes 3-4 hrs to full charge. I leave it to charge all night2. A bit bulky: one handed usage is a bit difficultOneplus has smaller footprint with same screen size but v10 has fingerprint scanner in the front.3. Audio output: could have been betterSamsung, LG, oneplus all have great audio outputs. This one is a tad bit low on that front.4. No OIS or EIS : need steady hands for low light stills and videos are always shaky.5. Resale value : it will not get the resale value like iPhone or Samsung or even like oneplus. Monetary value for this one will fall greatly.I chose this over oneplus 5t because I wanted 128gb memory, front fingerprint scanner under 30k. With 3k extra oneplus 5t gives lower memory and for 128gb it costs 38k. Oneplus does not give anything special for 8k extra. Honor will not fetch a resale value like one plus but if you plan to use this for at least 2 years. You should be good.Read mor
